cbccore
Class Botball

java.lang.Object
  cbccore.Botball

public class Botball
extends java.lang.Object

A class that is primarily used in the Botball tournament. It provides several useful functions specific for that tournament.

Author:
Braden McDorman

Constructor Summary
Botball()
           
 
Method Summary
 void shutDownIn(double secs)
          Creates a new thread and terminates all movement of the robot after the time limit (set in the constructor) has been reached.
static void waitForLight(Analog light)
          This function calibrates and then waits for the difference to be greater than an average of the two calibration readings (the threshold between lights on and lights off).

clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
 

Constructor Detail

Botball

public Botball()
Method Detail

shutDownIn

public void shutDownIn(double secs)
Creates a new thread and terminates all movement of the robot after the time limit (set in the constructor) has been reached.

waitForLight

public static void waitForLight(Analog light)
This function calibrates and then waits for the difference to be greater than an average of the two calibration readings (the threshold between lights on and lights off). It does this by looping infinitely and updating the sensor reading, then comparing it to the threshold value.
